headline: Panama auditor files suit to scrap CK Hutchison-controlled port contract
summary: PANAMA CITY (Reuters) -Panama's comptroller general, Anel Flores, said on Wednesday he had filed suit to the nation's Supreme Court against a contract to operate ports near the Panama Canal, held by a local firm controlled by Hong Kong-based CK Hutchison.  Flores said the two suits were to declare the unconstitutionality and to nullify the contract to operate the Balboa and Cristobal ports.  The Supreme Court would still need to accept the request to hear the comptroller's complaint.

Flores said the two suits were to declare the unconstitutionality and to nullify the contract to operate the Balboa and Cristobal ports.  The Supreme Court would still need to accept the request to hear the comptroller's complaint.

headline: Crypto ETFs Get Major Relief From SEC
summary: Bitcoin, Ether and other crypto ETFs are no longer limited to cash transactions — they can use in-kind creation and redemption.

raw.headline: Crypto ETFs Get Major Relief From SEC
raw.summary: Bitcoin, Ether and other crypto ETFs are no longer limited to cash transactions — they can use in-kind creation and redemption.

headline: BlackRock's Rosenberg Sees Tricky Environment Ahead for Fed
summary: Jeffrey Rosenberg, portfolio manager of the systematic multi-strategy fund at BlackRock, reacts to the Federal Reserve's policy-setting Federal Open Market Committee decision to hold its benchmark federal funds rate in a range of 4.25%-4.5%.
